thread.title: Is Albert Square set for ANOTHER disaster? EastEnders fans spot possible second tragedy with three more major characters at risk
thread.title_full: Is Albert Square set for ANOTHER disaster? EastEnders fans spot possible second tragedy with three more major characters at risk

author: Alistair McGeorge
title: Is Albert Square set for ANOTHER disaster? EastEnders fans spot possible second tragedy with three more major characters at risk
text:
TV Is Albert Square set for ANOTHER disaster? EastEnders fans spot possible second tragedy with three more major characters at risk Dedicated viewers of the long-running BBC show fear that Shirley and Tina Carter could be axed from the show Share Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now Watch: Huge bus smashes into Bridge Street Market Share this video Get soaps updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
Fans of BBC soap EastEnders aren't just reeling from last night's tragedy, which saw a double-decker bus crash into Albert Square's famous market. Now, they fear a second one is around the corner. 
Viewers of the long-running show are panicked that a parallel storyline will also descend into loss of life - with Shirley, Sylvie and Tina Carter also at risk as they travel on the London Underground. 
The possibility was heavily implied during Monday's episode, when the three women were seen getting sentimental on a rare tube ride - unusual scenes in the soap. 
Although BBC bosses haven't confirmed or denied it, there's surely some risk that the devastation will extend into tonight's instalment, especially as the rogue bus crashed into the railway bridge minutes earlier. Fans fear Shirley, Tina and Sylvie could be next in the soap's cull (Photo: BBC) EastEnders' shocking bus crash has startled viewers and critics alike (Photo: BBC) 
Fans took to Twitter to express their theories, stating: "Anyone else think the train is also going to crash tomorrow?" while another added: "Bus crash into tube bridge with the tube train coming..." 
A third chimed in: "Now the bus has crashed into the bridge, odds on their being a train crash tomorrow too!?" 
The Mirror have contacted representatives at the BBC, but are yet to receive a response. 
If true, the organisation could be in for further criticism after some viewers were left angry at the 'insensitivity' of the storyline so soon after the Berlin terror attack on December 12, when a truck was driven into a Christmas market, killing 12 and injuring more than 50. Currently, up to 11 Albert Square favourites could be left with their lives in the balance after the shocking scenes on Monday night's episode. Read More 
After the bus driver seemed to suffer a heart attack on the way back to the square, the vehicle span out of control and crashed through the market before hitting the bridge - and it could be fatal. Set-up for a fall?The women share an unusually sentimental moment on the tube (Photo: BBC) Who has perished in the crash? (Photo: BBC) The chaotic scenes divided viewers (Photo: BBC) Favourits are at risk (Photo: BBC) Video Loading Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now
